summary: Claude Ready for Code Search and Exploration

content.text:
I'm Claude Code, Anthropic's file search specialist CLI. I'm ready to help you navigate and explore your codebase efficiently.

I understand:
- **My role**: Finding files using glob patterns, searching with regex, reading file contents, and analyzing code
- **My location**: Working in `/Users/levi/data`
- **My capabilities**: Glob for pattern matching, Grep for content search, Read for specific files, Bash for file operations
- **My constraints**: Use absolute paths, no file modifications, avoid emojis, follow the project guide in CLAUDE.md

I've reviewed the project instructions in `/Users/levi/data/CLAUDE.md`, which outlines:
- Project structure (src/, tests/, docs/, scripts/)
- Development workflow and testing practices
- Architecture patterns and best practices
- Special commands like `/graham` for agentic workflows
- Access to research tools (Exa, Firecrawl) for web searches and data gathering

I'm ready to help with:
- Finding files in your codebase
- Searching code and text content
- Reading and analyzing specific files
- Providing file paths and code snippets in my responses

What would you like me to search for or explore?

content.text:
{
  "nodeType": "nodes-base.gmail",
  "displayName": "Gmail",
  "documentation": "---
#https://www.notion.so/n8n/Frontmatter-432c2b8dff1f43d4b1c8d20075510fe4
title: Gmail node documentation
description: Learn how to use the Gmail node in n8n. Follow technical documentation to integrate Gmail node into your workflows.
contentType: [integration, reference]
priority: high
---

# Gmail node

Use the Gmail node to automate work in Gmail, and integrate Gmail with other applications. n8n has built-in support for a wide range of Gmail features, including creating, updating, deleting, and getting drafts, messages, labels, thread.  

On this page, you'll find a list of operations the Gmail node supports and links to more resources.

/// note | Credentials
Refer to [Google credentials](/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/index.md) for guidance on setting up authentication. 
///

--8<-- "_snippets/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/ai-tools.md"

## Operations

* **Draft**
	* [**Create**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/draft-operations.md#create-a-draft) a draft
	* [**Delete**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/draft-operations.md#delete-a-draft) a draft
	* [**Get**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/draft-operations.md#get-a-draft) a draft
	* [**Get Many**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/draft-operations.md#get-many-drafts) drafts
* **Label**
	* [**Create**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/label-operations.md#create-a-label) a label
	* [**Delete**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/label-operations.md#delete-a-label) a label
	* [**Get**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/label-operations.md#get-a-label) a label
	* [**Get Many**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/label-operations.md#get-many-labels) labels
* **Message**
	* [**Add Label**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#add-label-to-a-message) to a message
	* [**Delete**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#delete-a-message) a message
	* [**Get**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#get-a-message) a message
	* [**Get Many**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#get-many-messages) messages
	* [**Mark as Read**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#mark-as-read)
	* [**Mark as Unread**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#mark-as-unread)
	* [**Remove Label**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#remove-label-from-a-message) from a message
	* [**Reply**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#reply-to-a-message) to a message
	* [**Send**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/message-operations.md#send-a-message) a message
* **Thread**
	* [**Add Label**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#add-label-to-a-thread) to a thread
	* [**Delete**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#delete-a-thread) a thread
	* [**Get**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#get-a-thread) a thread
	* [**Get Many**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#get-many-threads) threads
	* [**Remove Label**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#remove-label-from-a-thread) from thread
	* [**Reply**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#reply-to-a-message) to a message
	* [**Trash**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#trash-a-thread) a thread
	* [**Untrash**](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/thread-operations.md#untrash-a-thread) a thread

## Templates and examples

<!-- see https://www.notion.so/n8n/Pull-in-templates-for-the-integrations-pages-37c716837b804d30a33b47475f6e3780 -->
[[ templatesWidget(page.title, 'gmail') ]]

## Related resources

Refer to Google's [Gmail API documentation](https://developers.google.com/gmail/api) for detailed information about the API that this node integrates with.

n8n provides a trigger node for Gmail. You can find the trigger node docs [here](/integrations/builtin/trigger-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmailtrigger/index.md).

--8<-- "_snippets/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/operation-not-supported.md"

## Common issues

For common errors or issues and suggested resolution steps, refer to [Common Issues](/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmail/common-issues.md).
",
  "hasDocumentation": true
}

content.thinking:
The user wants to understand how the Gmail node works in n8n and what operations it supports. I've retrieved the documentation which provides a comprehensive overview. Let me provide a clear explanation based on this information.

This is a straightforward informational request, so I don't need a todo list for this task.

content.text:
# Gmail Node in n8n

The Gmail node allows you to automate Gmail operations and integrate Gmail with other applications in your n8n workflows.

## Authentication
You'll need to set up Google credentials to use this node. n8n supports OAuth2 authentication with Google.

## Supported Operations

The Gmail node supports four main resources with various operations:

### **Draft Operations**
- **Create** - Create a new draft email
- **Delete** - Delete a draft
- **Get** - Retrieve a specific draft
- **Get Many** - Retrieve multiple drafts

### **Label Operations**
- **Create** - Create a new label
- **Delete** - Delete a label
- **Get** - Retrieve a specific label
- **Get Many** - Retrieve multiple labels

### **Message Operations**
- **Add Label** - Add a label to a message
- **Delete** - Delete a message
- **Get** - Retrieve a specific message
- **Get Many** - Retrieve multiple messages
- **Mark as Read** - Mark message as read
- **Mark as Unread** - Mark message as unread
- **Remove Label** - Remove a label from a message
- **Reply** - Reply to a message
- **Send** - Send a new message

### **Thread Operations**
- **Add Label** - Add a label to a thread
- **Delete** - Delete a thread
- **Get** - Retrieve a specific thread
- **Get Many** - Retrieve multiple threads
- **Remove Label** - Remove a label from a thread
- **Reply** - Reply to a message in a thread
- **Trash** - Move a thread to trash
- **Untrash** - Restore a thread from trash

## Key Features

- **AI Tool Compatible** - The Gmail node can be used as an AI tool with AI agents
- **Gmail Trigger Available** - There's a separate Gmail Trigger node for starting workflows based on incoming emails
- **Full API Integration** - Integrates with the official Gmail API

## Use Cases

Common automation scenarios include:
- Sending automated email responses
- Managing email labels and organization
- Processing incoming emails with triggers
- Creating and managing draft emails
- Email threading and conversation management

The node provides comprehensive Gmail functionality for building sophisticated email automation workflows.

message.content: coonect to my n8n instance and show me all existing workflows

content.thinking:
The user wants me to connect to their n8n instance and show them all existing workflows. To do this, I need to use the n8n MCP tools. Let me first check if n8n is configured properly and then list the workflows.

I should:
1. First, maybe do a health check to see if n8n is accessible
2. Then list the workflows

Let me start with the health check and list workflows.

content.text: I'll connect to your n8n instance and retrieve all existing workflows.

content.thinking:
The health check succeeded and shows that n8n is accessible at https://n8n.srv1056595.hstgr.cloud/, but the list_workflows call failed with an authentication error. This means the API key is not properly configured or is invalid.

I should let the user know about this authentication issue and help them resolve it. They need to configure their n8n API key properly.

content.text:
I can see your n8n instance is running at `https://n8n.srv1056595.hstgr.cloud/`, but I'm getting an authentication error when trying to list workflows.

## Issue
The n8n API key is either:
- Not configured
- Invalid or expired
- Missing proper permissions

## How to Fix

1. **Get your n8n API key:**
   - Log into your n8n instance at https://n8n.srv1056595.hstgr.cloud/
   - Go to Settings → API
   - Create or copy your API key

2. **Configure the API key for the MCP server:**
   - The n8n MCP server needs the following environment variables:
     - `N8N_API_URL` - Your n8n instance URL (already configured)
     - `N8N_API_KEY` - Your API key (needs to be set)

3. **Set the environment variable:**
   ```bash
   export N8N_API_KEY="your-api-key-here"
   ```

   Or add it to your MCP server configuration file where the n8n MCP server is configured.

Once you've configured the API key, I'll be able to list your workflows and perform operations on your n8n instance. Would you like help setting this up?
